newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Malan plays down import financing concerns.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Malan plays down import financing concerns.

text.p: Brazilian Finance Minister Pedro Malan said concerns from members of the Mercosur trade bloc over new restrictions on import financing were a "tempest in a teacup", a local news agency said.
Malan also said Brazil would not bow to pressure from Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay -- its fellow Mercosur members -- who want their exports to Brazil to be exempted from the new measures.
"This is just another tempest in a teacup," Malan was quoted as saying by newswire Invest News.
Brazil's Central Bank last week announced restrictions on import financing of under a year, with the aim of preventing importers from benefiting from low international interest rates.
The Brazilian government denied there was anything "protectionist" to the new rules, although analysts have said they were designed to help plug Brazil's widening trade deficit.

Brazil's three partners in Mercosur have complained they were not previously consulted on the measures. Argentine Economy Minister Roque Fernndez may travel to Brazil Wednesday to present the case for Mercosur exemption.
Invest News quoted Malan as saying he expected the differences between Brazil and Argentina over the new rules to be resolved shortly.
